emuInput.TitMainTitle: Group portrait of four ministers wearing dark vestments, including Reverend Allen on right, posed in Ebenezer AME Church during AME General Conference, Detroit, another version
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, Philadelphia edition, May 11, 1940, pg. 1 reads: " 'In God's Name Have Mercy!' Shouts Vernon As Conference Blasts Hopes - Delegates Deaf to Eloquent Plea of Former Leader in Church - Episcopal Committee Firm for Retirement, but Refuses to Pass on Character. - FLASH! No Appeal for Vernon! - Detroit, Mich., May 9 - In a heated battle on the Conference...Monday morning. Bishop W.T. Vernon lost his last chance to appeal the decision of the body made Saturday when his reinstatement...active bishop was refused.  The vote to reconsider was...against."  Portion of accompanying article by Julia B. Jones reads: "Detroit, May 9 - A torrent of "ayes" and "Nays" burst forth here Saturday morning when the all-powerful Episcopal Committee, in its first report to the Assembly, recommended that Bishop W.T. Vernon of Kansas remain...the retired list..."
